item.title: Fortnite Leaks Suggest Overwatch Crossover Could Happen
item.content:encoded:
When you think of modern-day online shooters, you have to consider Overwatch and Fortnite. It feels almost wrong that the two brands haven’t come together at some point. New leaks suggest the sought-after crossover between the two giants is happening—brace yourself.

Fortnite is still red-hot and untouchable in 2025, whereas Overwatch 2‘s (and the brand as a whole) has dropped off a bit in recent times, but it’s still a bona fide behemoth in the shooter genre. The two franchises have never partnered up once over the years, but leaks suggest this could change.

Fortnite & Overwatch Crossover Possible, According To Leaks

Hypex (One of the world’s biggest sources for news and leaks) has shared new information—courtesy of SpushFNBR and Wensoing—of a potential collab. They stress that this is only a “POSSIBLE” collab, so take this information with a huge pinch of salt until we know more.

SpushFNBR shared leaked assets on December 11, revealing a bunch of LEGO heads and pieces. One headpiece that players were quick to jump on was a potential match for Hanzo, from Overwatch. It appears to only be for LEGO, though.

Hypex explained about the Hanzo hair model: “It was used on an early version of a Fortnite LEGO skin, then removed, then re-added today again.”

There’s not too much more to go on for now. Fortnite is lining up a bunch of collabs coming up, including South Park, Harry Potter, Kim Kardashian, and anything else Epic Games can get its hands on, it seems.

Would you like to see a Fortnite and Overwatch collab? Share your most-wanted collabs through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Read about Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 breaking an all-time The Game Awards record and how to get a PUBG Black Budget Alpha Key on Steam for more news and content.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Broke All-Time The Game Awards Record
item.content:encoded:
With Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 up for a record number of nominations at The Game Awards 2025, there was every chance it would bring home many of those accolades. Sure enough, the RPG cleaned up at The Game Awards 2025.

It was a huge night for Sandfall Interactive and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. The surprise news that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 DLC dropped through a free update was fun, and it rounded off a successful night for the mega-popular role-playing game.

The Game Awards 2025 Record Broken By Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

With many of the Sandfall Interactive crew in attendance at The Game Awards 2025 dressed up in striking French-inspired gear, there was an air of expectation that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 would do something very special.

Nearly four hours later, the 2025 GOTY took home nine of the 13 awards it was nominated for. This smashes the previous record of most awards accumulated in one night, set by The Last of Us Part 2’s seven awards at the 2020 show.

In other years, Forza Horizon 5 and It Takes Two claimed three awards each in 2021, God of War Ragnarok took home six in 2022, Baldur’s Gate 3 matched GOW’s feat in 2023, and Astro Bot was the recipient of four last year.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 won:

  • Game of the Year
  • Best Game Direction
  • Best Narrative
  • Best Art Direction
  • Best Score and Music
  • Best Performance
  • Best Independent Game
  • Best Debut Indie Game
  • Best Role Playing Game

Do you think Sandfall’s debut RPG release was worth the hype? Does it deserve the nine awards it claimed? Have any games been cruelly robbed of an award, such as Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 for Best RPG? Head to the Insider Gaming Discord Server and let your feelings be known.

There is much more TGA 2025 news to catch up on, such as Star Wars Galactic Racer being revealed, Phantom Blade Zero getting a release date, and Deadpool coming to Marvel Rivals in 2026.
